question: 熱い
sourceMnemonic: This is for when a thing is <kanji>hot</kanji>, making this word <vocabulary>hot thing</vocabulary>. When the weather is hot that's <ja>暑い</ja>. This is when you touch something and you burn yourself.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: This has the same reading as <ja>暑い</ja>, so if you've learned that you'll know how to read this word as well. If you haven't run into that word, you've probably run into the kanji <ja>暑</ja> at least. That uses the reading <ja>あつ</ja>. Two similar concepts, but there are two kanji to differentiate, which gets confusing.
